body.name: Hoowel Smart Watch for Men and Women - Alexa Built-in Smartwatch with Heart Rate, Sleep and Blood Oxygen Monitor,24/7 Heart Rate Auto Image Correction, Portable Smartwatch Dynaudio Speakers (Black)

features: 📞Make/Answer Call - After connecting to your phone via Bluetooth, you can answer/make clear calls directly from your smart watches for men. You won't miss important calls from your lover/friend while you're working out or driving.

💖24/7 Health Monitoring - activity trackers and smartwatches records your daily steps, distance, calorie consumption,and features advanced sensors to monitor heart rate, blood oxygen levels, and sleep patterns. All recorded data can be synced to your phone for analysis.

⌚1.8'' HD Screen & 100+ Watch Faces - The smartwatch boasts a large 1.8-inch full touch color screen, delivering exceptional picture quality and highly responsive touch sensitivity, all while being resistant to scratches. With an extensive collection of over 100 watch faces to choose from, you can personalize your men's or women's watch by selecting your favorite photo as the dial.

🏃100+ Sports Modes & Water Resistant - The Hoowel fitness tracker supports over 100 sports modes such as swimming, running, rock climbing, and yoga, keeping track of exercise time and calories burned to help you maintain a healthy balance between activity and rest. It has an IP68 waterproof rating, so you don't have to worry about washing your hands, face or even sweating when using it.

🔋30-Day Long Standby Time - The fitness watch lasts about 7-10 days of daily use and can reach up to 30 days of standby time. The Hoowel smartwatch is compatible with most Android and iOS phones. You can quickly charge it with the included magnetic charging cable while also setting the brightness, ringer, and wake function on/off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This watch offers all of the features I'm looking for, comes in four different color choices, and is reasonably priced. It's easy to set up, user-friendly, and exactly what I wanted. The watch has over 100 watch faces, a light-up screen, and is touchscreen as well. It's even Alexa-compatible, so I can use it with my voice.This is well-made, trendy, and comfortable enough to wear for long periods of time. It's a rechargeable device with an adequate battery life. For use with the watch, you must download and set up an app on your phone, although this is a simple process. The best part is there are no monthly fees to use this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well made with all smart watch features including calling
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I am really surprised with all the features this watch offers especially given the low price. The watch supports calling and lets you make and answer calls directly from your wrist, which is really convenient. You can add your frequently used contacts and personalized ringtone to each contact. There are many watch faces and you can even add a foto from your foto album as a watch face. The smartwatch actively tracks your daily steps, consumption of calories, and distance you walk. It also has advanced sensors to monitor your heart rate, blood oxygen levels, and sleep patterns and store them in your phone. It also has integrated software that conducts daily in-depth analysis of your health and fitness progress, keeping you healthy and safe in real-time. Surprisingly, it supports over 100 sports modes, such as swimming, running, and rock climbing. What’s even more surprising is battery life. I charged it fully before first use, and after 48hrs I still have 29% battery left, this is with all features on including Bluetooth, messaging, and phone calls. It even has Alexa built in. I went to the beach and completely forgot I had the watch on my wrist. I remembered to take it off after 30 min maybe, no water damage to it, even with the salty water. I freaked out because the instructions said it was not suitable for salty water. Very Very pleased with this watch. I am almost certain the current price is undervalued, perhaps purposely perhaps not but it’s is really cheap for all it does. Did I say superior battery life? The bracelet is soft silicone but buckle style and while I like blush pink, I will be looking for a different bracelet so I can change the look every now and then. I am in the process of finding out the exact bracelet specs and if I can find a replacement, I will share here too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars great product for price point, esp compared to apple watch
reviews.reviewText: works really well for what it is- i can’t get it to connect to alexa for some reason, but that’s not too important- the battery lasts a long time, the heart/step/o2 tracking works really well (once in the 2 months ive been wearing it, the step counter deleted several thousand steps, so that was weird, but honestly the only real issue i’ve had), but i’m giving 4 stars bc the charging port is kind of odd? it has two magnets that it connects to, and mine if finicky, the magnets flip around and its kind of annoying to set down without the charger turning, also because the charging cord is really short. but overall if you’re looking for a watch for a health related reason, this is a really good one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So cool and functional
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This stylish lil smartwatch not only looks great on both men and women, but it also packs a punch when it comes to features.Love, love love the built-in Alexa functionality is a game-changer. With just a quick voice command, I was able to check the weather, set reminders, and even listen to my favorite tunes. It was like having a personal assistant right on my wrist!The heart rate, sleep, and blood oxygen monitor are incredibly accurate and provided me with valuable insights into my overall health. The 24/7 heart rate auto image correction feature ensured that I was always getting accurate readings, which is a great help for tracking my fitness progress.Best feature - easy to set up and sync with your phone

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly responsive smart watch & looks good on the wrist with plenty of watch face options!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This watch is surprisingly impressive for the price and it is totally worth it. It looks great on the wrist too. Has tons of features and the connection was easy too. I would highly recommend this watch in the budget category.My 2 cents below:Pros:- Watch looks very classy with a nice design. Have 100+ watch faces loaded into the watch- Screen is bright and the touchscreen is responsive. No issues with this touch display screen as of now- Voice assistants are built-in that comes handy to use- Looks very nice on the wrist. Kudos to the design- Strap fits well and is comfortable in long usage too- Has tons of apps and features related to health and various sports modes too- It is a USB charger and hence has wide compatibility with powering method- Has good battery backup overall- Connection to the phone was easy and smooth. The Mobile app worked well without crashing on my iPhone- Very reasonably priced for the features it offersCons:- The mobile app is not very intuitive & has scope for improvements

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great watch but…..
reviews.reviewText: The only complaint I have is that it uses °C and kgs instead of °F and LBS

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the money
reviews.reviewText: I like the size of the display it's easy to read. It is well built and feels great for the price. I would definitely buy again. I like the watch faces and was pleasantly surprised how easy it was to connect to my phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: UnreliableI bought this watch to monitor my oxygen levels which are at a high 80% since I had COVID last year. The watch tells me I'm at 98%. (Even Apple now admits their watches can't monitor oxygen levels). I also wanted to monitor my sleep hours. If you get up in the night it considers you are up and stops recording. I also was interested in how many steps I take on an average day. I'm not shooting for 10,000 but just curious. You would be surprised how many steps it "records" while I am asleep! 200-300 a night! And it calculates my caloric intake without me entering any foods. It does get the time, date, and blood pressure correct and was fairly easy to connect with my phone.Don't get your hopes up with this device.
